title: Red Fort Blast: NIA arrests Umar Nabi’s another aide who was involved in modifying drones, trying to make rockets
text:
The NIA has arrested a second Kashmiri accused, Kasir Bilal Wani, for allegedly modifying drones and attempting rocket-making to support the Delhi blast conspiracy. (Express Photo)

The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Monday arrested a resident of Jammu and Kashmir, an alleged co-conspirator and close aide of Umar Nabi, the man who drove the i20 car that exploded near the Red Fort on November 10, claiming 12 lives so far. This comes a day after the NIA made its first arrest in the case.

The NIA identified the man as Kasir Bilal Wani alias Danish, a resident of Qazigund in Anantnag district. “He was an active co-conspirator behind the attack and had worked closely with the terrorist, Umar Nabi, to plan the terror carnage,” a NIA spokesperson said.
